title: Spack requires interactive bash shell to work
body:
@adamjstewart @tgamblin 

I have been working on putting the QMCPACK and QE Spack package into a nightly test script that runs on my Ubuntu Argonne-managed Linux box. The nightly test script runs as a user-level cronjob (not root).

I have modified this script so that it works correctly in both an interactive Terminal and inside the cronjob environment. This is the modification that I had to do:
`#!/bin/bash -i`
instead of
`#!/bin/bash`

If the script is invoked without an interactive bash session (without the `-i`), it only works in the interactive Terminal on Ubuntu, but fails in the cronjob environment. There is a link time failure due to what appears to be mixing wrong GCC versions. Note that I am using the Intel compiler and with a very specific version of GCC. I don't see a problem with GCC compilers.

I apologize if I failed Bash 101 and perhaps this is expected behaviour. At minimum, I think the behaviour should be documented here:
https://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/getting_started.html

[test_qmcpack_files.tar.gz](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/3039531/test_qmcpack_files.tar.gz)
